normal.statement: Which of the following is the site of actual diffusion of gases in human lungs?
The volume of air inspired or expired during normal breathing is called:
Oxygen is transported in blood mainly as:
The respiratory centre in human brain is located in:
Which of the following is NOT a part of conducting zone of respiratory system?
The maximum volume of air a person can breathe in after a normal expiration is called:
Carbon dioxide is transported in blood mainly as:
The enzyme carbonic anhydrase is found in:
Which of the following muscles are involved in normal inspiration?
options: Abdominal muscles and internal intercostal muscles

normal.statement: The volume of air that remains in the lungs after maximum expiration is called:
The covering of lungs is called:
Which of the following has the highest affinity for oxygen?
The Hering-Breuer reflex is associated with:
The partial pressure of oxygen in alveolar air is about:
Which of the following is the correct pathway of air during inspiration?
The chloride shift occurs in:
The volume of air that can be exhaled after normal expiration is called:
Which of the following factors decreases oxygen affinity of hemoglobin?
The Adam's apple is formed by:
The maximum volume of air a person can breathe out after a maximum inspiration is called:
Which of the following is NOT a function of conducting part of respiratory system?
options: Transport of atmospheric air to alveoli

normal.statement: The oxygen dissociation curve is:
The partial pressure of carbon dioxide in venous blood is about:
Which of the following is true about expiration?
The respiratory pigment in human blood is:

moderate.statement: Which of the following statements about hemoglobin is correct?
options: It has higher affinity for O₂ than CO
It has no affinity for CO
It has equal affinity for CO and O₂
It has higher affinity for CO than O₂
moderate.answer: It has higher affinity for CO than O₂

moderate.statement: The Bohr effect refers to:
options: Effect of temperature on oxygen affinity of hemoglobin
Effect of 2,3-DPG on oxygen affinity of hemoglobin
Effect of pH on oxygen affinity of hemoglobin
Effect of pCO₂ on oxygen affinity of hemoglobin
moderate.answer: Effect of pH on oxygen affinity of hemoglobin

moderate.statement: Which of the following is correct regarding transport of CO₂?
The vital capacity of human lungs is about:
Which of the following conditions would shift oxygen dissociation curve to the right?
The chloride shift maintains:
Which of the following is NOT true about alveoli?
options: They are lined by ciliated epithelium
moderate.answer: They are lined by ciliated epithelium

moderate.statement: The Haldane effect refers to:
options: Effect of temperature on CO₂ transport
Effect of oxygen on CO₂ transport
Effect of CO₂ on oxygen transport
Effect of pH on oxygen transport
moderate.answer: Effect of oxygen on CO₂ transport

moderate.statement: Which muscle is called the 'pacemaker of respiration'?
The respiratory membrane consists of:
Which of the following is true about surfactant?
options: Has no effect on surface tension

moderate.statement: The partial pressure of oxygen in atmospheric air is about:
Which of the following is the correct order of decreasing pO₂?
options: Alveolar air > atmospheric air > arterial blood > venous blood
Atmospheric air > alveolar air > arterial blood > venous blood
Alveolar air > arterial blood > venous blood > atmospheric air
Atmospheric air > alveolar air > venous blood > arterial blood
moderate.answer: Atmospheric air > alveolar air > arterial blood > venous blood

moderate.statement: The chemosensitive area in brain is sensitive to:
Which of the following is true about emphysema?
The oxygen carrying capacity of hemoglobin is:
Which of the following is NOT a chronic respiratory disorder?
The volume of anatomial dead space is about:
Which of the following factors increases the rate of diffusion of gases?
The respiratory quotient for carbohydrates is:
Which of the following is true about fetal hemoglobin?
options: Has higher affinity for oxygen than adult hemoglobin
Has same affinity for oxygen as adult hemoglobin
Has lower affinity for oxygen than adult hemoglobin
moderate.answer: Has higher affinity for oxygen than adult hemoglobin

moderate.statement: The pneumotaxic centre is located in:
Which of the following is the correct pathway for CO₂ transport from tissues to lungs?
options: Tissue → plasma → RBC → bicarbonate → plasma → alveoli
moderate.answer: Tissue → plasma → RBC → bicarbonate → plasma → alveoli

moderate.statement: The apneustic centre is located in:
Which of the following is true about asthma?
options: It involves inflammation of bronchi and bronchioles
It results in decreased residual volume
It is caused by bacterial infection
It is characterized by destruction of alveolar walls
moderate.answer: It involves inflammation of bronchi and bronchioles

moderate.statement: The total lung capacity in adult human is about:

hard.statement: Which of the following statements about 2,3-diphosphoglycerate (2,3-DPG) is correct?
options: It decreases oxygen affinity of hemoglobin
It has no effect on oxygen affinity
It binds to heme group of hemoglobin
It increases oxygen affinity of hemoglobin
hard.answer: It decreases oxygen affinity of hemoglobin

hard.statement: The oxygen dissociation curve shifts to right during exercise due to:
Which of the following is true about respiratory volumes?
The Hamburger phenomenon is another name for:
Which of the following conditions would cause maximum shift of oxygen dissociation curve to left?
The respiratory membrane thickness is about:
Which of the following is true about carbon monoxide poisoning?
options: It decreases oxygen carrying capacity of blood
It increases oxygen carrying capacity of blood
It has no effect on oxygen carrying capacity
hard.answer: It decreases oxygen carrying capacity of blood

hard.statement: The most important factor that affects diffusion capacity of respiratory membrane is:
Which of the following statements about pleural fluid is correct?
options: It allows easy sliding of lungs during breathing
It decreases surface tension in alveoli
hard.answer: It allows easy sliding of lungs during breathing

hard.statement: The respiratory quotient for fat is about:
Which of the following is true about compliance of lungs?
options: It is not affected by surfactant
It is the ability of lungs to expand
hard.answer: It is the ability of lungs to expand

hard.statement: The most powerful stimulus for breathing in healthy person is:
Which of the following is true about neonatal respiratory distress syndrome?
options: It is caused by deficiency of surfactant
It is caused by excess surfactant
hard.answer: It is caused by deficiency of surfactant

hard.statement: The partial pressure of oxygen in tissues is about:
Which of the following factors does NOT affect pulmonary ventilation?
The Haldane effect is quantitatively more important than Bohr effect because:
options: CO₂ is transported mainly as bicarbonate
O₂ is transported mainly as oxyhemoglobin
CO₂ is more soluble than O₂
O₂ is more soluble than CO₂
hard.answer: CO₂ is more soluble than O₂

hard.statement: Which of the following is true about diving mammals?
options: They don't use oxygen for respiration

hard.statement: The respiratory centre is most sensitive to:
options: Both increase in pCO₂ and decrease in pH
hard.answer: Both increase in pCO₂ and decrease in pH

hard.statement: Which of the following is the correct sequence of events in CO₂ transport?
The maximum diffusion capacity for oxygen in human lungs is about:
Which of the following is true about Cheyne-Stokes breathing?
options: It is characterized by increased depth and rate
It is seen in healthy athletes

hard.statement: The respiratory quotient for protein is about:
Which of the following is NOT a function of nasal cavity?
The most important muscle for forced expiration is:
Which of the following is true about carbonic anhydrase?
options: It is not required for CO₂ transport
It works better at alkaline pH

neet.statement: Which of the following is the correct combination for transport of respiratory gases?
options: O₂ - 97% as oxyhemoglobin, CO₂ - 70% as bicarbonate
O₂ - 70% as oxyhemoglobin, CO₂ - 97% as bicarbonate
O₂ - 3% dissolved in plasma, CO₂ - 7% dissolved in plasma
O₂ - 23% as carbaminohemoglobin, CO₂ - 20% as carbaminohemoglobin
neet.answer: O₂ - 97% as oxyhemoglobin, CO₂ - 70% as bicarbonate

neet.statement: A person has tidal volume of 500 ml, inspiratory reserve volume of 2500 ml, expiratory reserve volume of 1000 ml, and residual volume of 1200 ml. What is his vital capacity?
Which of the following conditions will NOT shift the oxygen dissociation curve to right?
The volume of air that remains in conducting passageways and does not participate in gas exchange is called:
Which of the following is the correct statement about regulation of respiration?
options: Chemoreceptors are sensitive to O₂ only

neet.statement: A person at high altitude will have:
Which of the following is true about carbon dioxide transport?
options: Most CO₂ is transported as carbaminohemoglobin
Chloride shift occurs in arterial blood
Haldane effect promotes CO₂ transport in tissues
Bohr effect promotes CO₂ transport in lungs
neet.answer: Haldane effect promotes CO₂ transport in tissues

neet.statement: The respiratory membrane consists of all EXCEPT:
Which of the following pairs is correctly matched?
The chloride shift involves:
options: Movement of Cl⁻ into RBC in tissues
Movement of Cl⁻ out of RBC in tissues
Movement of Cl⁻ into RBC in lungs
Movement of HCO₃⁻ into RBC in tissues
neet.answer: Movement of Cl⁻ into RBC in tissues

neet.statement: Which of the following factors increases the rate of gas diffusion across respiratory membrane?
The oxygen dissociation curve is sigmoid because:
options: Oxygen is poorly soluble in blood
Carbon dioxide competes for binding sites

neet.statement: In which of the following conditions would you expect the oxygen dissociation curve to shift maximally to left?
Which of the following statements about surfactant is correct?
options: It is produced by type I pneumocytes

neet.statement: The most important stimulus for controlling respiration under normal conditions is:
Which of the following is true about myoglobin?
options: It has lower affinity for oxygen than hemoglobin
It is found in blood plasma

neet.statement: The respiratory quotient is less than 1 when the respiratory substrate is:
Which of the following is NOT a feature of emphysema?
The Hering-Breuer reflex prevents:
Which of the following is the correct pathway for oxygen transport from alveoli to tissues?
The volume of air that can be inspired after normal inspiration is called:
Which of the following is true about carbonic anhydrase?
options: It catalyzes reversible reaction between CO₂ and H₂O
It works better at alkaline pH
It is not required for CO₂ transport
neet.answer: It catalyzes reversible reaction between CO₂ and H₂O

neet.statement: The partial pressure of carbon dioxide in alveolar air is about:
Which of the following muscles is NOT involved in forced inspiration?
The oxygen carrying capacity of blood is reduced in:
Which of the following is true about the regulation of breathing?
options: Central chemoreceptors are sensitive to O₂
Peripheral chemoreceptors are sensitive to CO₂ only
Aortic and carotid bodies are peripheral chemoreceptors
Medulla is not involved in respiratory rhythm
neet.answer: Aortic and carotid bodies are peripheral chemoreceptors
